metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35824 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.3.2. A use-after-free was found in dm1105_remove in drivers/media/pci/dm1105/dm1105.c. It was discovered that the SDMC DM1105 PCI device driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition during device removal, leading to a use- after-free vulnerability. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-35824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required
